description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cqrt9","text":"This recipe is used to grow algae in the genus Anabaena, Dolichospermum, and Aphanizomenon in the Duffy lab. It can be used to grow other freshwater cyanobacteria cultures.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
document: {"blocks":[{"key":"1fmtv","text":"Written by: K. Hunsberger, February 2016","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"65l76","text":"Updated by: K. Sánchez, March 2021","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1lfba","text":"Based on methods from Australian National Algae Culture Collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aqqgv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fg8a2","text":"MLA Medium Preparation","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fp13n","text":"Summary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"erqdt","text":"This recipe is used to grow algae in the genus Anabaena, Dolichospermum, and Aphanizomenon in the Duffy lab. It can be used to grow other freshwater cyanobacteria cultures.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":47,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1tjjs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1gtal","text":"Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"anarm","text":" Apparatus & Equipment Labware Reagents Autoclave 1L polyethylene bottles Sodium nitrate, NaNO3 Aluminum foil Graduated cylinder Calcium chloride, CaCl2•2H2O Autoclave tape 500 mL beakers Magnesium Sulfate, MgSO4•7H2O Analytical balance stirring magnet Potassium phosphate dibasic, K2HPO4 Weight boats or paper 5L glass aspirator bottle Boric acid, H3BO3 Rubber cap for 5L Selenious acid, H2SeO3 Rubber hose Copper (II) sulfate, CuSO4 · 5H2O spatula Iron (III) chloride, FeCl3 Zinc sulfate, ZnSO4  · 7H2O Cobalt (II) chloride, CoCl2  · 6H2O Sodium molybdate, Na2MoO4 · 2H2O EDTA, Na2EDTA Sodium bicarbonate, NaHCO3 Manganese (II) chloride, MnCl2 · 4H2O ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":966}],"data":[]},{"key":"d9mdq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"chvld","text":"1. Stock Solutions Set #1: Using the analytical balance, weight the prescribed amounts of each of chemicals in the table below. Dissolve the prescribed amount of each chemical into 1 L (final volume) of MilliQ water. There will be 5 separate solutions. Store in polyethylene bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"22f4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ulga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9teeo","text":"2. Vitamin Solution: Use the solution in the fridge labeled VIM. (This VIM solution is from the Standard COMBO Medium Protocol and contains Vitamin B12, Biotin, and Thiamine-HCl. See protocol for specific concentrations.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":60,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":149,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1qj67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fkveq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fpat4","text":"3. Micronutrient Primary Stocks: First prepare these 4 primary stocks by adding the prescribed amount to MilliQ water for a final volume of 1L. There will be 4 separate solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7mpbd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1pbh9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bujct","text":" Compound Symbol g/L MilliQ Copper (II) sulfate CuSO4 · 5H2O 1.0 Zinc sulfate ZnSO4  · 7H2O 2.2 Cobalt (II) chloride CoCl2  · 6H2O 1.0 Sodium molybdate Na2MoO4 · 2H2O 0.6 ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":261}],"data":[]},{"key":"d4nak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8s45l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4re1a","text":"4. Micronutrient Stock Solutions: Dissolve the prescribed amount of the following constituents in ~800 mL of MilliQ water. Allow each to mix and dissolve completely before adding the next ingredient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bk5as","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5f07b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bmim","text":" Compound Symbol g EDTA* Na2EDTA 4.36 Iron (III) chloride FeCl3 · 6H2O 1.58 Sodium bicarbonate NaHCO3 0.60 Manganese (II) chloride MnCl2 · 4H2O 0.36 ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":233}],"data":[]},{"key":"3npma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4oon0","text":"*Add the EDTA first and stir on low heat to fully dissolve.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8c9n1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ak2la","text":"Then, add 10 of each of the 4 primary stock solutions. Bring the final volume up to 1L. If a precipitate forms, increase the pH up to 7. This solution is the micronutrient stock solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e25ph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8kko1","text":"5. Stock Solution Set #2: Dissolve the prescribed amount of each chemical into 1 L (final volume) of MilliQ water in 1L flasks. There will be 2 separate solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4a4ag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9151u","text":"6. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6bdvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"499ue","text":" Compound Symbol g/L MilliQ Sodium bicarbonate NaHCO3 16.9 Calcium chloride CaCl2 · 2H2O 29.4 ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":146}],"data":[]},{"key":"8p8bj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"almro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5cq9k","text":"Autoclave each of the compounds using the setting number 2 of the BSB autoclaves in floors 4th & 5th(or 121 °C for 15 minutes) and then store in 1L glass bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":92,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":98,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2k7i3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"abfq3","text":"7. MLA x40 Concentrated Nutrient Solution: Prepare this 1L solution by adding the following volumes of the stock ingredients to 540 mL MilliQ water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dcion","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7juej","text":" Solution Volume to add MgSO4 · 7H2O 40 mL NaNO3 80 mL K2HPO4 200 mL H3BO3 40 mL H2SeO3 40 mL VIM Solution 20 mL Micronutrient stock solution 40 mL ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":245}],"data":[]},{"key":"6svfh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"tejk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4aj9g","text":"Filter sterilize using a 0.22 mm filter into a sterile 1L glass bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvipr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6bq7p","text":"STORE ALL OF THE ABOVE STOCK SOLUTIONS AND PRIMARY STOCK SOLUTIONS IN THE FRIDGE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a126i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ujrl","text":"Final MLA Medium Preparation: is prepared by adding ~750 mL MilliQ water for each liter. Then, add the correct amount of each solution according to the following table. After adding all of the solutions, the volume should be increased to the specified final amount and adjusted to a pH of 7.5-8 with HCl (if necessary). Prepare final solution in a 1L or 5L aspirator bottle. Place the rubber stopper laterally (so it does not completely plug the top opening of the aspirator bottle) and completely cover the top with aluminum foil. Cover the end of the rubber hose with aluminum foil (or connect it to the second aspirator bottle if setting up a new culture). Autoclave the mixture by selecting program number 2 in the autoclaves found in the 4 or 5th floor of the BSB building (or at 121 °C for 15 min). Allow to cool in autoclave overnight, if possible. This helps to minimize amount of precipitate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":30},{"style":"sup","offset":749,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f9fnu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9d52","text":"
